p: The emergence of dengue and Chikungunya in Europe is associated with the establishment of Ae. albopictus and Ae. aegypti, together with mutation of Chikungunya virus that facilitated infection of Ae. albopictus. The mosquitoes became infected after feeding on returning travellers carrying infections obtained overseas. The emergence is, therefore, not directly associated with climate change although climate has undoubtedly played an important role in determining the geographic area where transmission is possible, and climate change may have extended that range [ 25].
